Name: Upload files by FTP from package
Description:
Upload files to a remote server via File Transfer Protocol (SFTP or FTP) using WinSCP.

This step template uses the [WinSCP .NET Assembly](http://winscp.net/eng/docs/library#downloading_and_installing_the_assembly).  In the absence of WinSCP installed on the machine, it will attempt to make use of the WinSCP PowerShell module, downloading a temporary copy if not already present. 

# Notes on usage

This version uses a referenced package parameter and is able to be run on a Worker.

## Cleaning up deployments

If you aren't deploying to an application host and don't want the deployment files to persist on the tentacle irrespective of the life cycle retention policy ensure that you set the "Delete Previous Deployment" to `true` and they will be removed.
Author: twerthi

Parameters.Name: PathToWinScp
Parameters.Label: Path to WinScp
Parameters.HelpText: The directory where you extracted the WinSCP .NET Assembly.

Parameters.Name: FtpHost
Parameters.Label: Host
Parameters.HelpText: The address of your FTP server. Example: `ftp.yourhost.com`.

Parameters.Name: FtpUsername
Parameters.Label: Username
Parameters.HelpText: If no username is specified, the well-known username `anonymous` will be used.

Parameters.Name: FtpPassword
Parameters.Label: Password
Parameters.HelpText:
If no password is specified, the well-known password `guest` will be used.

If the password field is bound, the binding expression will be visible to other authorized users.

Parameters.Name: FtpHostKeyFingerprint
Parameters.Label: Host Key Fingerprint(s)
Parameters.HelpText: By supplying a host key fingerprint (or a semicolon separated list), you will force the deployment into SFTP mode, and automatically accept the host certificates.

Parameters.Name: FtpPasskey
Parameters.Label: Passkey
Parameters.HelpText: Path to the PPK passkey file, leave blank if using a Password

Parameters.Name: FtpPasskeyPhrase
Parameters.Label: Passkey Phrase
Parameters.HelpText:
If your passkey is encrypted, please supply the pass phrase.

If the password field is bound, the binding expression will be visible to other authorized users.

Parameters.Name: FtpRemoteDirectory
Parameters.Label: Remote directory
Parameters.HelpText: The directory on your FTP server in which you want files to be placed. Example: `/site/wwwroot`

Parameters.Name: FtpDeleteUnrecognizedFiles
Parameters.Label: Delete unrecognized files
Parameters.HelpText: Files can exist on the FTP server that do not exist in the NuGet package. Examples may be binaries from a previous release, or uploaded images in a CMS. Use this option to choose how to treat these files.

Parameters.Name: DeleteDeploymentStep
Parameters.Label: Delete Deployment Step?
Parameters.HelpText: Should this script delete the deployment - for example, if you are running this on the Octopus Server, you might want to clean up the output of the previous package deploy step when this has completed.
